actions.committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

official_title: A bill to establish a program of awards by the National Science Foundation for undergraduate students who are willing to commit themselves to teach elementary or secondary mathematics or science for a specified period of time.
short_title: National Math-Science Teacher Corps Act of 1989

summary.text: National Math-Science Teacher Corps Act of 1989 - Directs the National Science Foundation to establish a merit competitive award for students enrolled in the last two years of a baccalaureate degree program in science, mathematics, or engineering who are willing to commit themselves to teach elementary or secondary school science or mathematics. Sets each such award at $7,500 per year. Limits each individual to two such awards, but allows a third award for education courses for teaching certification. Requires recipients to serve as teachers for two years for each award received, within six years after graduation. Requires repayment for failure to complete such service obligation. Authorizes appropriations for FY 1990 through 1993.

titles.title: National Math-Science Teacher Corps Act of 1989

A bill to establish a program of awards by the National Science Foundation for undergraduate students who are willing to commit themselves to teach elementary or secondary mathematics or science for a specified period of time.
